intro: Chrysanthemum tatsienense, commonly known as the Tatsienlu chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically the Tatsienlu region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features finely divided, feather-like leaves. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial shade to full sun.
